lexUnit.name: sprawl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: sit, lie, or fall with one's limbs spread out in an ungainly way.

sentence.text: With an involuntary yell of alarm she tumbled forward and sprawled full length in the muddy water .
She sprawled awkwardly as one of the women lost control of her legs .
Léonie sprawled lower on the muddy carpet and looked up at the beech trees spread against the sky .
She sprawled flat on the hard wooden floor , her cry abruptly silenced as all the air rushed out of her body .
The door shot open , knocking Bill from his feet and sending him sprawling across the sidewalk .
His return fire lifted Weaver off his feet and flung him two yards backwards , to sprawl at Bodie 's feet as Bodie came racing through the side garden .
The Labrador , a much easier-going animal , edged its way towards her and sprawled at her side , wistfully eyeing her food but much too well mannered to help himself .
Once she fell over , sprawling in the snow .
Jay poured brandy and sprawled on the floor .
The tap-room of the tiny inn was down a deep step and he nearly sprawled on the tiled floor , coming abruptly into the cool darkness .
Lumberjack sprawled on the tiles at her feet , whining softly in his sleep like a damp log on a fire .
Shortly afterwards , the home side broke away for Shearer to be sent sprawling by Stejskal , before picking himself up and converting the spot kick .
Morris sprawled back in the one armchair with his whisky , watching them all impassively .
Douglas sprawled back in Steven 's green high-winged chair , feeling very good .
His head struck it with a loud crack and he slowly crumpled against it , sinking to his knees and then sprawling on to the grass .
Chaplin invited Mayer to land one on him , and L B promptly obliged by punching Chaplin in the face , sending him sprawling over a potted plant .
His foot caught in the grass , and he sprawled headlong .
He sprawled untidily , grabbed at Rostov 's arm , and brought him down .
